skill.name: Senior Backend Engineer
skill.description: Comprehensive backend development skill for building scalable backend systems using NodeJS, Express, Go, Python, Postgres, GraphQL, REST APIs. Includes API scaffolding, database optimization, security implementation, and performance tuning.
skill.summary: Complete toolkit for senior backend development with Node.js, Python, Go, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, and REST APIs
skill.author: Claude Skills

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and tooling skill containing Python CLI scripts for API scaffolding, database migration, and load testing. The static scanner produced 63 false positive findings by misidentifying markdown code fences as shell backticks and YAML frontmatter as cryptographic algorithms. All detected patterns are benign documentation and standard Python file I/O operations.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Line 20 is a markdown code fence containing TypeScript class example code (```typescript). The static scanner misidentified triple-backtick markdown syntax as shell backtick execution. No command execution exists.

content.user_title: Build Scalable Backend Systems with Senior Guidance
content.value_statement: Design and implement production-ready backend systems with automated tools for API scaffolding, database optimization, and performance tuning. The skill includes three CLI tools and comprehensive reference guides for Node.js, Python, Go, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, and REST APIs.
actual_capabilities: Scaffold REST and GraphQL APIs using automated Python scripts with configurable templates
Analyze and optimize database queries with migration tooling and performance recommendations
Generate load testing reports for API endpoints to identify bottlenecks
Apply backend security practices including authentication, authorization, and input validation patterns
Follow established API design patterns and anti-patterns from reference documentation
limitations: Does not generate complete production applications - provides scaffolding and guidance only
Does not execute actual database migrations - generates migration files for review
Does not perform real-time production monitoring or alerting

use_cases.title: Generate API Boilerplate
use_cases.description: Quickly scaffold new API projects with best-practice structure and configurations for Node.js, Python, or Go.

use_cases.title: Optimize Database Queries
use_cases.description: Analyze existing database patterns and receive recommendations for query optimization and indexing.

use_cases.title: Validate API Performance
use_cases.description: Run load testing analysis on existing APIs to identify performance bottlenecks and scaling issues.

prompt_templates.title: Create New API
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-backend skill to scaffold a new REST API project at /path/to/project using Node.js and Express with authentication endpoints.

prompt_templates.title: Database Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the senior-backend database migration tool to analyze /path/to/project and provide optimization recommendations for PostgreSQL queries.

prompt_templates.title: API Load Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-backend api_load_tester to analyze the API at /path/to/api and generate a performance report with bottleneck identification.

prompt_templates.title: Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the backend_security_practices reference guide and apply authentication and authorization patterns to my existing API code.

output_examples.input: Scaffold a GraphQL API for a new user management service using Python and PostgreSQL
output: Generated API scaffold with GraphQL schema and resolvers
Created database models for User with authentication fields
Added input validation and error handling patterns
Configured PostgreSQL connection with async support

output_examples.input: Analyze my current database queries and suggest optimizations
output: Identified 3 N+1 query patterns in user retrieval
Recommended composite indexes for frequently queried columns
Suggested query caching strategy using Redis
Provided migration script for new index creation

output_examples.input: Generate a load test report for my authentication endpoints
output: Tested 5 authentication endpoints under 1000 RPS load
Found latency spike in login endpoint at 500 RPS
Identified database connection pool exhaustion at 800 RPS
Recommended increasing pool size and adding rate limiting

best_practices: Always review generated scaffold code before committing to production use
Test database migrations on staging environments before applying to production
Combine multiple senior-backend tools for comprehensive API development workflows
anti_patterns: Do not apply generated code directly to production without security review
Avoid running database migration tools against production databases without backup
Do not skip input validation even when using scaffolded authentication code

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports Node.js, Express, Python, Go, TypeScript, JavaScript, Kotlin, and Swift for backend development.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with cloud databases?
faq.answer: Yes, the database tools work with PostgreSQL, NeonDB, Supabase, and other PostgreSQL-compatible cloud providers.

faq.question: Does the load tester actually send requests?
faq.answer: The load tester analyzes API structure and generates load testing configurations and reports, but does not execute external requests.

faq.question: How do I customize the generated API scaffolding?
faq.answer: Pass options to the api_scaffolder.py script or modify the generated template files before deployment.

faq.question: Is the skill suitable for microservices architecture?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns and tools support both monolithic and microservices architectures with container deployment guidance.

faq.question: Does this skill handle authentication implementation?
faq.answer: The skill provides authentication patterns and scaffolding templates, but actual implementation requires customization for your specific requirements.
